00059 #ifndef HEADER_RC5_H
00060 #define HEADER_RC5_H
00061 
00062 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00063 extern "C" {
00064 #endif
00065 
00066 #ifdef OPENSSL_NO_RC5
00067 #error RC5 is disabled.
00068 #endif
00069 
00070 #define RC5_ENCRYPT 1
00071 #define RC5_DECRYPT 0
00072 
00073 /* 32 bit.  For Alpha, things may get weird */
00074 #define RC5_32_INT unsigned long
00075 
00076 #define RC5_32_BLOCK        8
00077 #define RC5_32_KEY_LENGTH   16 /* This is a default, max is 255 */
00078 
00079 /* This are the only values supported.  Tweak the code if you want more
00080  * The most supported modes will be
00081  * RC5-32/12/16
00082  * RC5-32/16/8
00083  */
00084 #define RC5_8_ROUNDS    8
00085 #define RC5_12_ROUNDS   12
00086 #define RC5_16_ROUNDS   16
00087 
00088 typedef struct rc5_key_st
00089     {
00090     /* Number of rounds */
00091     int rounds;
00092     RC5_32_INT data[2*(RC5_16_ROUNDS+1)];
00093     } RC5_32_KEY;
00094 
00095  
00096 void RC5_32_set_key(RC5_32_KEY *key, int len, const unsigned char *data,
00097     int rounds);
00098 void RC5_32_ecb_encrypt(const unsigned char *in,unsigned char *out,RC5_32_KEY *key,
00099     int enc);
00100 void RC5_32_encrypt(unsigned long *data,RC5_32_KEY *key);
00101 void RC5_32_decrypt(unsigned long *data,RC5_32_KEY *key);
00102 void RC5_32_cbc_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00103             long length, RC5_32_KEY *ks, unsigned char *iv,
00104             int enc);
00105 void RC5_32_cfb64_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00106               long length, RC5_32_KEY *schedule,
00107               unsigned char *ivec, int *num, int enc);
00108 void RC5_32_ofb64_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
00109               long length, RC5_32_KEY *schedule,
00110               unsigned char *ivec, int *num);
00111 
00112 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00113 }
00114 #endif
00115 
00116 #endif
